listing.listing_description:
This luxury three bedroom villa is in a quiet setting of mature gardens and a private swimming pool with colorful sea and mountain views. The white exterior walls of the property stand out brilliantly against the deep blue of the ocean below it. Ammos accommodates a maximum of six guests. Children are welcome and there’s a childcare service available (additional costs apply and advance notice is needed) should you require it.

With so many amenities within the villa, you will be truly spoiled for choice during your time here. There are plenty of modern conveniences such as Wi-Fi, satellite television and stereo system. The outdoor space has many charms of its own including an al fresco shower, swimming pool and outdoor living area. Privacy is assured at all times as Ammos is situated in a gated community. The indoor and outdoor areas merge seamlessly to create the feeling of one large overall space to relax and enjoy yourself without a care in the world. Waking up in the villa every day is an experience you’ll want to last forever.

Natural stone and whitewashed wood combined with subtle tones of yellow, white and blue blend perfectly with the island theme of sun, sea and sand. The light and airy interior is cozy and charming. Generous balconies and terraces enjoy far-reaching views over the pool to the sea. The soft white candle lights, comfortable couches under whitewashed pergolas and the fragrance of flowering jasmine create an inviting, magical ambience. In the kitchen, there’s everything you’ll need to prepare light snacks or more formal dinners.

All three bedrooms in the villa are well-equipped. They each have air conditioning, en-suite facilities and televisions. The master bedroom has a jetted tub while bedroom three has its own sauna and mini-gym. With the villa located in such a serene location, you’ll soon be asleep each night dreaming of what delights await you on waking the following morning.

The surrounding areas complement this villa wonderfully well. The calm and restful scenery is enough to keep you occupied for hours. The village of Almirida is just a five minute walk away, as is the beach. When you just want to get away from the hectic pace of life, Ammos delivers.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All Rights Reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Please note: Villa Alpha is a semi-detached property and can be booked alongside Villa Votsalo (https://www.luxuryretreats.com/vacation-rentals/greece/crete/chania/villa-votsalo-120554) to make up the Youphoria Beachfront Estate (https://www.luxuryretreats.com/vacation-rentals/greece/crete/chania/youphoria-beachfront-estate-120556)! Please inquire with your Villa Specialist for more details!

If you’re looking for an amazing vacation, you can’t beat true beachfront property. Villa Alpha is steps from the sandy coast line of Kissamos Bay. With crystal clear, calm water and a private location, Kissamos Bay is perfect for first time snorkelers, a family fishing trip, or just soaking up the sun while you enjoy your beachfront vacation home.

A minimalistic approach to interior decoration allows Crete’s unique features to remain the focal point of your getaway. Turquoise water, bright blue sky, and glowing sunlight set the tone throughout the Villa Alpha property. Wide openings from the interior to the terrace ensure that fresh ocean breeze easily flows through Alpha’s living spaces. High-end furniture and state of the art electronics are the living room’s decor. The formal dining area has space for four, and there’s alfresco dining on the terrace as well. The kitchen is fully equipped with top notch appliances and plenty of countertop workspace.

You’ll always feel calm, cool, and connected at Villa Alpha. With television, air conditioning, a sound system, and Wi-Fi, you’ll have everything you need. The two master bedrooms both feature en-suite bathrooms with stand-alone showers and access to the terrace. Once outside, you’ll love the outdoor furniture around the infinity pool, it’s the perfect place to have a glass of wine and watch the sun set.

Nearby, the Chania region is well known as an archaeological hot spot. With several significant findings throughout its history, Chania is home to some amazing museums. The city itself has the charm of an old fishing village, because that’s what it has always been. So take some time to explore the taverns, restaurants, and local markets in Chania, if you’re a seafood lover, you’re in the right place.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
The huge pool, palm trees and broad plaza of this private home, located just outside Marrakech, give it a sense of royal prestige. Everything is on a finer and grander scale here, from the rooftop dome and sun terrace, to spacious bedrooms and balconies, to the long banquet table and shaded, North African-inspired dining tent. Famous souk markets, golfing, and natural attractions are all nearby.

Watch a golden dawn break over the grounds of this villa from comfortable living room sofas, before freshening up in the decadent, walk-in bathrooms. Slip into the expansive swimming pool for a swim amidst the sunlight and blue tiling, before gathering for a pleasant group lunch in the desert-style tent. Space and serenity are at the core of this home’s appeal, with individuals and couples always able to slip away to various comfortable seats and furnished nooks around the grounds. At mealtimes, the premium barbecue, and fully-equipped kitchen help to ensure a fun and relaxed vacation environment.

From this location, guests can explore the colorful attractions of this part of Morocco. The busy city of Marrakech is a feast of eye-arresting sights, ranging from historical artisanal gardens, to fascinating museums, to souks filled with unique wares and local craftsmanship. Experience delicious coffee and national cuisine like zaalouk and tagine in welcoming local restaurants, or embrace a refreshing sauna or afternoon on a well-maintained golf course. The local countryside is ideal for guided outings, including 4x4 rentals and hiking through resplendent mountain valleys. 

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
The sea on one side, mountains on the other—this contemporary South African villa looks over photo-ready scenery from all angles. The aquamarine infinity pool has a completely unobstructed view of the town below. Strategically placed skylights and windows illuminate the sleek black, white, and stainless steel colour scheme. Cape Town is a 10-minute drive away where you’ll have access to seafood restaurants, spas, and a vibrant nightlife. 

One of the finest beaches in the area, Camps Bay Beach is within walking distance. Lay your towel down on the soft white sand and spend the day soaking up rays and waves. If you forget to pack a bag, don’t worry—sunscreen, food and drinks, as well as loungers and umbrellas are available for purchase nearby. Lion’s Head mountain provides a dramatic backdrop to the city; snap a photo for your Instagram after making the 90-minute trek to the top, taking in the 360⁰ sights around you.

An at-home cook provides breakfast and lunch that you can savour either inside or alfresco, both with seating for 8. Happy hour won’t be complete without a glass of wine from Constantia, the region’s vineyard, which is only a short drive away. Terrace loungers are the perfect place to curl up while watching the vivid sunset unfurl against the palm trees and city beyond. Set the mood with your favourite playlist by plugging into the outdoor sound system.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Ensconce yourself in one of Santorini’s calmer villages, with the valley views welcoming you every morning. From these heights, fresh sea breezes cool the terraced balcony to great effect. A shaded seating area lies alongside the brilliant colored pool, while inside, inventive stone featuring flavors the pleasant dining and seating areas. Beaches and fascinating ancient sites all lie close by.

Constructed with a nod to traditional Greek styles, this villa incorporates a white color scheme to deflect heat as well as curved domes to retain warmth into the night. The rich, solid and dark wooden shutters can be flung open to allow sunlight to stream into the interior rooms, which are outfitted to an impressive modern standard, while retaining references to the wild, rugged landscape of Santorini via subtle stonework and basalt furniture. A lengthy and comfortable sofa is paired with a bleached wood table for the ideal indoor relaxation space, while the shaded balcony, and airy outdoor dining table provide more spots for guests to find their own ideal relaxation spot.

For those interested in the historic riches of Santorini, you couldn’t have picked a better spot to explore some of the most unique sites in all of the Mediterranean. The buried city of Akrotiri, doomed by the Santorini eruption is stunningly preserved just 8 kilometers away, while the hilltop ruins of Thera are located every closer to the villa. A number of excellent beaches, including the famed Kamari Black Pebble beach are located within a short drive, while the direct locality offers an impressive range of classic Greek tavernas, restaurants and bars to choose from, before returning home for a flavorsome, locally-produced aperitif on the pleasant and dusky terrace.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Find a Winelands idyll at The Residence at Vrede en Lust. Tucked into the picturesque Franschhoek Valley on the 330-year-old Vrede en Lust Wine Estate, this vacation rental is a sophisticated retreat in a gorgeous rural setting. Spend your holiday exploring the area’s golf courses, spas and galleries—or board the region’s wine tram and find your new favorite vintage.

Your stay at The Residence includes housekeeping service, breakfast and a complimentary wine tasting at Vrede en Lust. Watch the sun move across the surrounding hills from private outdoor living areas with a swimming pool, lounging and dining furniture, a bar, a barbecue and a sound system, then linger after sunset around the firepit. Or enjoy indoor amenities ranging from a gym and office space to a streaming TV, sound system and Wi-Fi.

The outdoor spaces connect seamlessly with interiors whose architectural charm and comfortable furnishings create a feel of laid-back luxury. With several sitting areas, a dining table that seats twelve and a fully equipped kitchen with a breakfast bar, you can spend a quiet moment reading or reconnect with the whole group of friends and family over a meal.

The Residence has four bedrooms with king beds, including two honeymoon-worthy suites with their own lounge areas and balconies. The other two bedrooms have two twin beds each. All six bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms and air conditioning.

With Franschhoek only a 10-minute drive from the villa, it’s easy to spend the day touring the area’s galleries, teeing off at nearby golf courses or indulging at a range of spas. For something a little wilder, make the 10-minute drive to Drakenstein Lion Park. Of course, you can always take the Franschhoek Wine Tram, which has a stop at Vrede en Lust, and see the area without having to drive at all.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Shades of blue—sea, sky, pool, mountains in the distance—complement the red-orange earth around this modern stone villa on Crete’s Bay of Chania. The panoramic views are reflected in the glass façade and framed by rows of sliding doors connecting the interiors to the outdoors.

Listen to the waves lapping at the rocks from a terrace that stretches the width of the villa, featuring an infinity pool and plenty of loungers. Cool off with a drink in the covered alfresco sitting area, and open a bottle of local wine to go with dinner from the charcoal barbecue at the dining table for 8.

The villa’s rock walls feel like part of the island landscape, and its bright, open rooms feel inspired by the beach, with light pouring in through walls of windows, and blues and grays drawn from water and stone. Curl up with a book on one of the mod sofas in the living room, and sit down to dinner from the fully equipped kitchen at the breakfast bar or dining table.

It’s a 2-minute drive to the closest beach and less than a 10-minute drive to many other beaches, where you can swim in the clear water or pause for a drink at a beachfront taverna. Plan a day trip to the nearby city of Chania to explore its narrow streets, snap a photo of its lighthouse, and spot Venetian influences in its 14th-century harbor.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Take a Moroccan holiday on a grand scale at the elegant Palais Tika. With nearly four acres of grounds, more than 16,000 square feet of living space and eleven bedrooms, this stately property offers a luxury stay to parties of up to twenty-two friends or family members. Its location in the popular La Palmeraie resort area feels quiet and private, but is close enough to central Marrakech for an easy day trip.

During your stay, a butler, housekeeper, cook and security staff will ensure your comfort. Spend lazy days swimming in the large pool and enjoying views of the Atlas Mountains from loungers on the terrace, and relaxed evenings gathered in the traditional caidal tent. Inside, the villa’s amenities range from an exercise room and hammam area to an iPod dock and Wi-Fi.

Gracefully arched doors lead from the outdoor living areas at Palais Tika to a refined living and dining room indoors. Several sitting areas and a large table provide plenty of room for everyone to gather, and modern touches—an arc lamp or leopard-print pillow—set off the polished traditional furnishings. Though cook service is included, the villa does have a fully equipped kitchen.

There are eight bedrooms in the main house of this vacation rental and three in a separate guest house; all eleven have king beds, en-suite bathrooms, fireplaces and an indoor lounge area or outdoor space.

The villa’s location puts you within a short drive of two golf courses. Don’t miss the chance, however, to spend a day or two in central Marrakech. After wandering the medina, a designated UNESCO World Heritage Site, visit the lush Jardin Majorelle and the newly opened Yves Saint Laurent Museum before sitting down to a honeymoon-worthy dinner at one of the city’s up-and-coming restaurants.

listing.listing_description:
It’s almost as though the city of Cape Town was built around the sightline connecting Lion’s Head and this stately penthouse suite. Sip your morning Nespresso on the balcony as the sun peeks out from behind the Table Mountain. If you’re interested in snapping a few pictures from the opposite vantage point, the hike up Lion’s Head takes about 90-minutes, and the view is breathtaking.

Named after the first governor of the Cape, Simon Van der Stel, the Labotessa penthouse is one of the city’s most prestigious rentals. Its central location puts you steps from the action. And, the view of Lion’s Head is simply the best. Designer furnishings show off Labotessa’s cutting-edge style, as do the top of the line tech features and appliances. The fully-equipped kitchen will surely inspire your inner chef to attempt local favorites like bunny chow or bobotie. After dinner, take a glass of wine to the balcony lounge by the plunge pool and watch the sunset.

Start your morning with a stroll along the Sea Point Promenade; it’s a great way to get the lay of the land. For lunch and a little shopping, check out V&A Waterfront, the city’s entertainment district. While you’re there, wander through the Zeitz Museum of Contemporary Art, displaying the most extensive collection of African art on the continent. For dinner, Camps Bay’s strip of beachfront restaurants will have something for everyone.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Don’t be surprised to find a friendly elephant enjoying a sip of water from the pool at this breezy safari villa on the Welgevonden Game Reserve. In fact, why don’t you and the family have a catered breakfast out on the patio with your new pal? Then, hop into a private, guided vehicle and take a journey through over 300-km of hilly landscape inhabited by South Africa’s most beloved creatures.

Mhondoro Safari Lodge South celebrates Africa with an open-air layout decorated in warm wood tones, natural stone, and state of the art appliances. The full-staff will take care of all your meals, drinks, and housekeeping, leaving you with time to fully immerse yourself in the safari. With 2 activities per day, you’ll decide between guided vehicle tours and walking tours with Mhondoro guides. At the Welgevonden Game Reserve, you’ll have a high chance of seeing the big 5, lion, leopard, elephant, rhino, and Cape buffalo, so make sure to pack a camera.

When you get home from an exciting day, you’ll find a completely refreshed and re-stocked villa waiting to host an unforgettable evening. After dinner, crack open a local beer and recount tales from the day by the living room’s fireplace. If you’re not quite ready to relax, head up to the star deck and see what you can spot through the telescope. Before bed, rejuvenate those safari muscles with a soothing soak in the master’s deep bathtub or enjoy a long alfresco shower.
